TopicTitle: Looking for a pair of reference images on atmosphere heights and science boundaries

Articles.Content:
A while back someone (I've forgotten who) posted a pair of images. They showed atmosphere height, low orbit boundary, and SOI (high orbit) boundary of every body in the Kerbol system. My HDD just died, and those images appear to be among the (thankfully very few) things that didn't get backed up properly. They were blue'ish gradient rectangles for each planet, easy to read. If anyone recognizes them and can provide a link I'd appreciate it, otherwise it's off to the wiki + GIMP for me...

Edited August 20, 2015 by SAI Peregrinus
Here are the images. I can not find the original thread, so if you are the creator, please stand up and take a bow.

This Wiki page has a table that seems to have the data you want.

This is not the image you're looking for, but the data may still serve your purpose.

Happy landings!

edit: And Alshain posted a link to the images you wanted while I was typing.

Alshain got 'em. Thanks. I know about the wiki and use Science Alert, it's just nice to have them 'cause they're pretty references. With the image names the original thread was easy to find: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124028-Altitude-boundary-charts-for-science-and-warp-speeds

They're made by LittleBlueGaming.

Edited August 20, 2015 by SAI Peregrinus
